Reviews.Title: “Very Refreshing, Modern, and Clean”
Reviews.Author: love2travel42
Reviews.Content: We were impressed with the nice rooms and wonderful decor throughout the hotel. Rooms were very comfortable. Continental breakfast wasn't your average breakfast. We enjoyed our stay. Walked to Joe's Crab Shack.

Reviews.Title: “another good trip”
Reviews.Author: northportgary
Reviews.Content: well as always hyatt takes care of us, I think we have stayed at more hyatts than any other chain in our travel clean & price is great

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Place Hotels Never Fail Me”
Reviews.Author: Klbags
Reviews.Content: I love Hyatt Place and this location did not fail to impress me. For the $$, the service and interior features are some of the best. Our sofa was a little worn, but other than that nice room with comfortable bed. The location is right in the middle of a shopping center and surrounded by restaurants that you could easily walk to. Not the safest spot in town, but not bad. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “BEST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER”
Reviews.Author: nora s
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the pleasure of staying a week at this hotel. From the minute we walked in and saw the self checkin to the best trained staff ever. BEAUTIFUL warm lobby! The rooms were clean, comfortable even through the bathroom is somewhat small. I loved it and will come back many time. We have family in memphis and would rather pay than stay with family. The area has many eating places and the best mall right accross the street. THANK YOU HYATT PLACE WE LOVE YOU AND WILL BE BACK.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay -- A downsized full service hotel”
Reviews.Author: WayneCarter
Reviews.Content: Loved the quick and easy kiosk check in. You pick bedtype, high or low floor, out comes your keys. The staff was very helpful, despite reviews of rude staff I never saw this. There was one guy who was rather disinterested, and a woman who was a little gruff, asking 50+ folks for their ID's and having no sense of humor about it. But whatever. I stayed here two weeks on business and was generally very happy. There's a blonde who works in the morning who I literally wanted to scoop up and take home. She was so friendly, cheery, and just helpful. The actual bathroom tub showers are tiny, unless you get a handicapped room, but otherwise function is great. The hotel is clean, and in good shape. Be advised if you room service at night, you might have to wait. I called one night at 11pm when I got in after a late night at work and asked for a burger on the 24 hour room service. I was told by the guy at the front desk, "I already shut down the kitchen, I never sell food at night." I was like uh --- ok. lol I convinced him to make me a turkey sandwich since no oven was required and that was that. The a/c in room is rather loud.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money.”
Reviews.Author: ConcordiaFlyer
Reviews.Content: A nice business hotel with a pool, free wifi, great Germantown location, free breakfast, and manager's reception (read: free drinks). Staff was always very friendly and helpful. Great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Good location away from downtown, yet close enough to major tourist sites”
Reviews.Author: TMHK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights during a family reunion. There was a welcome reception with food/appetizers at the hotel. (The main reception was elsewhere.) The room was a good size; we had a suite with 2 beds for 3 small kids and 2 adults. The beds were very comfortable and clean. The outdoor pool was clean and fun for the kids. I used the laundry facilities -- convenient, no one was using them, there were 2 sets of washer/dryers. The staff were very helpful providing extra towels for the pool. The hotel is right in the middle of a huge mall shopping area. Initially this horrified us but it was fine, as it made the hotel easy to find. We didn't go shopping at all, but drove to some nearby local restaurants. Gus' Chicken had excellent (cheap!) fried chicken just north of this location. We also went downtown to see some museums and then to Graceland.

Reviews.Title: “A good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: bruce l
Reviews.Content: This place is not in the tourist part of the Memphis area but I wasn't there to see Beale street and downtown. It was a good value. I would stay there again if I return to Memphis on business.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly Modern, Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: keepin_it_100
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Place Memphis/Wolfchase Galleria was a nice, comfortable hotel with fairly modern accommodations. We stayed in a king bedroom the weekend of June 10-12 and I was pleased with the overall appearance of the hotel itself and cleanliness of the room. Upon first walking into the hotel, I will venture to say that I was impressed by the tasteful, modern dÃ©cor of the lobby and front desk, as well as the machines up front to allow guests an electronic check in/check out (no human interaction required). We were checked in quickly and the front desk associate was friendly and efficient. Walking into the room, the first sight is the large, flat screen LCD TV and seating area in the front room. The seating area is separated from the bed by a small, trendy partition which was nice to provide a bit of privacy in the event that you want to change while guests are present (should you be so bold). One downfall of the room was that the bathroom was tiny. You might chop off your leg trying to shut the door if youâ€™re not careful. I was expecting a bit more with the bathroom given how nice the room was; however, it was a standard bathroom with a tub/shower and toilet. Nothing more, nothing less. In previous reviews, people have noted that the bed is hard; however, I prefer a firm bed so I was happy with it. I was actually happy that it wasnâ€™t one of those sink-in beds as they provide nothing but back pain in the morning. One thing that was a bit disconcerting was the air conditioning. Now, it is Memphis so it was hot as Hades; however, the air was so bitterly cold (and located next to the bed) I had to keep a blanket and box of tissues handy. You will want to keep your air on considering that it will be hot and muggy in there if you donâ€™t; however, try sitting in the couch area on the other side. After the air blasts by the bed, it is nice and comfortable on the other side. Since the television swivels, you can simply swing it over to face the couch and your favorite shows will not be interrupted by the blustery cold. Overall, the air was not really a problem for me; however, the Hyatt provides an extra blanket in the room for those who are affected. Something that should be noted is that the location of this hotel is fantastic. It is right next to a ton of eating places (Joeâ€™s Crab Shack is literally 0.01 miles away) and stores. We are talking Target, TJMaxx, Lowes, Ross, Best Buy, HHGregg..you name it. For food, you could find anything from Chick-fil-A and IHOP to the Melting Pot, all in the same shopping center. How convenient and well planned! One thing that I wish they would invest in would be a pool. A nice pool. One that is larger (and more modern) than a road-side Motel 6. Perhaps I was again expecting too much (expecting more of a W instead of a Holiday Inn) but the modern nature of the rooms was misleading. I was looking forward to at least a few hours of sunbathing and dipping my toes in but I may have overlooked the fact that this is family friendly (not adults only) hotel, so once I saw all of the kids splashing around I figured that wouldnâ€™t be my scene. Despite the rinky dink pool (which I wasnâ€™t there for anyway), I still remained pleased with this hotel and would definitely stay there again. The rundown: this hotel is very clean, beds are comfortable (for those who like the firm bed), the room is fairly modern and trendy but the bathroom is the size of a closet. As long as you keep it in your mind that you are not in some swanky NYC hotel, you will really enjoy the Hyatt. Also, donâ€™t forget to get out and enjoy Memphisâ€”see the Civil Rights Museum and Beale Street if you have a chanceâ€”you will be glad that you did.

Reviews.Title: “WORST. STAFF. EVER.”
Reviews.Author: CinCityRN
Reviews.Content: Booking a trip & planning on staying in this seemingly nice, conveniently located hotel? [BUZZER]. This place, while typical in terms of rooms & public areas, takes a seriously huge dive when it comes to customer service. I cannot tell you how many times we received nasty jeers or sarcastic backhanded comments from EVERY LEVEL of service personnel. Room service? According to one employee, "You order it & then you come down & get it. You aren't in Beverly Hills." One night, when coming back from the city, the security guard treated us like convicted felons & PHYSICALLY escorted us to the front desk so he could "make sure you are who you say you are." Nevermind HE WATCHED US LEAVE THE HOTEL! When asking if the pool would be open at any point during our stay (an honestly OK question, I think), the employee behind the front desk stated, "Does it look like summer outside?" WOW. Just wow. Really. & God forbid you want anything EXTRA while you stay here. If you do, plan on emptying the contents of your entire checking account. Bottom Line-- the rudeness of the individuals working at this hotel left us with a bad taste in our mouths, both for the Hyatt company & the Memphis area. We might go back to Memphis, maybe, but you better believe we're making a beeline for the nearest Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “I CAN'T EVEN PUT A RATE ON HOW HORRIBLE MY STAY WAS, STAFF WAS UNACCEPTABLY RUDE”
Reviews.Author: mimketz
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a wonderful stay at a relaxing hotel with great customer service THIS IS NOT THE PLACE!!!! I have never encountered such RUDE, UNHOSPITABLE CUSTOMER SERVICE in my life!!! I will never stay at this hotel and I will never visit Memphis again!!! There is a college course for hotel management and the title is HOSPITALITY!!!! Apparently, no managers at this hotel are educated enough in this course!!! Employees lead by example and if management can't be curteous, how can they expect their staff to be. Other than the staff, this hotel might have a fighting chance of being a wonderful hotel. I am the most laid back, understanding person there is; however, I must say in regards to the staff here: Good luck if you stay here, check your temper at the door because odds are, it will flare up!!!! Ruined my vacation and put a bad taste in my mouth regarding the entire city, sorry Memphis!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Melvindog
Reviews.Content: I will not stay at a Hyatt Hotel again! The day staff was friendly. The night staff very uncourteous. Any extras way over priced. Room unclean.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible location - a warning”
Reviews.Author: TeacherKaz
Reviews.Content: The hotel and service are your average middle of the road hotel. Adequate breakfast included bagels, fruit, yogurt, juice and coffee. If you want anything else, be prepared to bring a Swiss bank account. The staff is friendly enough. The pool was closed even though it was in the 80's during our stay which was disappointing. VERY IMPORTANT: Know that you will NOT have a good night's sleep here. It is INCREDIBLY noisy as this hotel is directly next to a major highway on-ramp and every motorcycle in town loves to drive as fast as possible on that ramp. Also, if you're in town on a Wednesday, DO NOT stay here. There is a motorcycle competition in the parking lot that goes on until very late at night - not the hotel's fault, but irritating after driving all day nonetheless. We tried to opt for the air conditioner's obnoxious-motor sound to drown out the sound, but that didn't even help. Be forewarned. There are better options in the area; choose carefully.

Reviews.Title: “Did we all stay at the same hotel????”
Reviews.Author: trouble1964
Reviews.Content: After reading these other reviews, I wonder if perhaps we stayed at a different hotel, because we had none of the problems mentioned. When we arrived, I noticed a car that had a door open. I told the friendly and efficient desk clerk, and she said she would have it checked on. She really seemed concerned about the car and wanted to locate the owner. We were assigned a room on the 6th floor and it was very nice and spacious. The room was very large, neat and clean, the refrigerator was cold, and the ice buckets and glasses were not plastic....how often do you find THAT? I walked down the hall looking for the ice machine and passed a room with some very loud guests who were apparently having a small party. When I got back to the area of the elevators (still without finding the ice machine), a security guard stepped off. He asked me if I was looking for ice and told me it was on the floor below...strange but not a problem. I guess someone else had called about the loud guests because he headed in the direction of their room. I was impressed that the security was helpful to me even though he was handling another issue. We found the bed to be a little uncomfortable but that could be because we weren't used to it. The location is away from downtown Memphis but still close to great shopping and restaurants. Overall, we were really pleased with the room, the service, and have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Non clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: biztraveltn
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hyatt Place - Wolfchase Galleria location in Memphis and upon going to my first room location the air conditioner once turned on, sounded like a semi truck was in the room, which says to me the maintenance on the hotel was not up to par. Well, they switched me to a different room on the 6th floor and as I went in the restroom to take my nightly shower, I closed the door and so my surprise the soiled/dirty towels from the previous guest were still on the floor behind the door. This let me know that the room probably was not cleaned well from the last guest. When I alerted hotel staff, she looked at me dumb founded & had a blank stare. No I did not get a I am sorry, would you like a refund, nothing. Very disappointed, disgusted and all of the above. I took pictures just in case hotel management wanted to dispute with time and date stamps. Just nasty!

Reviews.Title: “Unprofessional Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: teach2nd00
Reviews.Content: This hotel is extremely nice. The dÃ©cor and ambiance of the hotel is so contemporary and modern. The rooms are spacious, clean, and comfortable and the location is great even though itâ€™s quite a distance from downtown Memphis (approx. a 20 minute drive) the hotel sits on the parking lot of a small shopping center with many different shops and restaurants surrounding it and there is a nice mall directly across the street. However, the customer service is totally unacceptable. The Guest Attendants were unprofessional, uncaring, and rude. Our checking in experience was continuously interrupted by either the phone ringing and the Guest attendant handling the callersâ€™ needs prior to ours, other guest returning to the front desk upset because they were sent to a room that had not being cleaned, or the Guest Attendant rudely walking off to handle something else in the middle of handling our check-in process. The policy of this hotel is check-in time is 3:00 however, when I made the reservations I requested an early check-in time and also called when we arrived into town to be certain that we would be able to get into our room early the attendant told me that our room would be ready around 2:30 or 3:00. None the less, it was almost 4:00 when we arrived to check-in when we finally received our room key after a long drawn out check-in experience we went to the room only to find housekeeping there cleaning the bathroom. Therefore, once again we had to wait until the housekeeper finished before we could get in. The next day I called Guest services to request additional towels I was told the towels would be right up well I never received the towels I saw the Housekeeping cart down the hall and went and got my own towels. There are two elevators in the hotel and they are pretty slow and hot, hot, hot. None of the attendants wore name badges which is poor customer service in itself. Although I love the warmth and comfort the hotel offers at the end of the day the unprofessional staff has caused me to never stay at another Hyatt EVER!!!

Reviews.Title: “Our Reservation was given to someone else before we even ARRIVED”
Reviews.Author: NIceHotelsNeeded
Reviews.Content: uThe Hyatt has established an excellent name for itself, but there is always a sour apple, and this hotel in Memphis, TN at the Wolfchase Galleria is the sour apple. We made our reservation way ahead of time and confirmed with them that our room was GUARANTEED and that no phone call is necessary to confirm our registration. Upon arrival, which was later in the evening, we were informed that the hotel was full and that our reservation was given to another client. PLEASE KEEP IN MIND that they were still going to charge us for the room without checking or notifying us. We never informed them that we were to cancel our reservation. This is horrible service, and a true inconvenience. How can one rely on a hotel with such prestige and great service when they treat their clients like this. Additionally, we reserved directly with the HOTEL, and willing to pay the full price, and not some discount online price. So to those who are traveling to this hotel for business which is in a great location, be cautious. Memphis is not a safe city, and when you expect great service for an expensive price, you WILL NOT get that with this Hyatt. Oh and the best they could do was to put us into a Best Western nearby (which is cheaper, and not the comfortable room that we expected, and we were not given any additional coverage for inconvenience). This is not an apology, this is just a way to shove a client like us away. I will not be staying at this hotel again because I expect to arrive to a GUARANTEED RESERVATION without complications. And for other business travelers, a GUARANTEED RESERVATION matters when you are focused on relaxation after a long trip. Truly unprofessional and unreliable. The very least that they could have provided was a an early phone call informing us of overbooking and difficulties with reservations. Instead they were willing give us no notification and still take our money. Truly unprofessional.

Reviews.Title: “Pluses and minuses”
Reviews.Author: ArkansasOrchid
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay in a Hyatt Place. On the plus side, the lobby and rooms are very stylish and attractive. The location is also great if you are looking for easy access to the Wolfchase Galleria and all the shopping and restaurants surrounding it. You literally take the road that the hotel is located on, pass through one light and you are at the mall. There are plenty of restaurants in the area including a Joe's Crab Shack (very busy) that is across the parking lot. Also a big plus was the extremely friendly front desk. Dante, the young man who was on duty when we arrived was very friendly and helpful. He greeted us and asked if he could do anything for us each time we walked through the lobby. He offered to walk over to the restaurant to get change for a hotel guest who needed to change a large bill because he didn't have enough in his money drawer. The woman who checked us out the next morning was equally friendly and helpful. Our room was clean and in good repair and the bedding was comfortable. On the negative side, the rooms are very small in comparison to hotel chains like Hampton and Holiday Inn Express. Very attractive, clean and well-decorated but with almost no drawer space, very limited closet space, etc. This makes a lot more sense for a single business traveler or a couple. It is just not a good set up for a family of three or four. Also, the in-room air conditioning unit in our room was very loud and cycled off and on all night. It sounded like an outboard motor. Some people may also find it annoying that the television (a large flat screen) is situated in-between the bedroom area and the living room area, so you have to watch it at an angle, no matter where you are. In my mind, the positives outweigh the negatives, especially if you are looking for a room for one or two people. If you are traveling with a family -- and especially if you are traveling with a family and planning to stay several days -- this may not be the best choice.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Melissa74
Reviews.Content: New and very nice! Very modern, free breakfast, great location, great price

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: HAYS_TRAVELER
Reviews.Content: This is a great business travel hotel because it is clean, comfortable, and convenient to lots of restaurants and shopping. It is in a great location that has easy access on and off the interstate. Rooms are comfortable, although the heaters in the room cycle on/off multiple times during the night and I've found that you need ear plugs if you are a light sleeper. The Hyatt staff is very friendly and always helpful! Breakfast is free and light (toast, cereal, yogurt, and fruit).

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, large, room.”
Reviews.Author: Elmhurstini
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice. Rooms were spacious, with a refrigerator and sitting area. Ours had two beds, and a pull-out sofa in the sitting area. Definitely need a car to get to downtown Memphis, but within walking distance of shopping mall and restaurants. Hotel staff was responsive to any questions we had. Breakfast included. About a 20 minute ride to Memphis airport. Arranged for Memphis City Tour bus tp pick us up at hotel for a half day tour, and they brought us back afterward.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay for a good price”
Reviews.Author: momAlabama
Reviews.Content: Went for a basketball tournament. Located near mall and plenty of restaurants. Place was clean and VERY roomy. It has more room than a standard hotel room. I liked having the separate sofa and table and extra sink in the room. Would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Thank you, thank you very much!”
Reviews.Author: CLSFortGordon
Reviews.Content: the area around the hotel has plenty of shopping, and places to get a good meal. The hotel's food, however, is "pricey" ($7.00 plus for an breakfast omlet, and $3.00 for a cookie! The rooms were very nice but had no microwaves. Limiting your eating possibilities during an extended stay. There is no sercurity in the parking area at all! An expensive piece of equipment was stolen out of my vehicle overnight which was parked right in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good stay”
Reviews.Author: NCD0003
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Hyatt Place near the mall about two weeks ago. The room was nicely decorated and the flat screen tv was great. There were only a few minor things that needed to be fixed such as the mini fridge was not very cold and the bathroom is really small. We stayed two days and received pretty good room service (we ordered pizza which was tasty) and our room was cleaned by hotel staff. The hotel staff were friendly and greeted us by name. My family did go to the pool and found that it was not very sanitary. There were leaves everywhere and there was a group of basketball teams that were staying in the hotel. They sort of crowded the pool area and were a bit noisy--they had won their tournament game so it was understandable. The location of the hotel is great, near restaurants, shopping, fast food places, and pretty much anything that you need. There was a walmart nearby and a walgreens too. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay near memphis but not in memphis. The area was nicer and better than staying in downtown memphis.

Reviews.Title: “Great for single; evaluate reviews if you are not alone.”
Reviews.Author: coloradocarol
Reviews.Content: First of all, as I write this, this same hotel is listed twice on TripAdvisor: both (here) as "Hyatt Place Wolfchase Galleria" and also as "Hyatt Place Memphis/Wolfchase Galleria". Read both listings. The most important thing I can tell you is that I would rate this Hyatt Place (and others) as "4" (excellent) for a business traveler or single person or maybe even for two people traveling light. But I would rate it as a "2+" (inadequate) for families or a couple not traveling light. It seems designed for single or business travelers. There is beautiful contemporary decor; a comfortable bed; a big screen plasma TV; an adequate complementary continental breakfast; 2 fast PC's & a printer in the business center; pleasant lounge; & wireless acess in the room worked fine. However, my husband and I arrived for a 3-day stay with lots of luggage and hanging clothes for several weeks on the road. And, we did not want to leave all our belongings in the car. There were only 3 smallish drawers in our room and a tiny closet. There were no luggage racks in the room or available at all per the desk clerk. So we climbed over suitcases stacked up on the floor for 3 days. The bathroom was extremely small -- with the bath mat on the floor, you can't open the bathroom door. Pillows on the king-sized bed were small. There was no way to leave a light on in the bathroom at night without glare in the mirror or leaving the fan on. A/C was really close to the bed. Room cramped. Fridge did not have any freezer compartment. No micro. Oh yes, don't plan to sleep in -- trash truck empties multiple dumpsters at 6:00 am. The swimming pool was not open even though it was mid-late May, it was hot, and other places we had stayed earlier in the month (St. Louis & Nashville) had pools open. I would not stay in any Hyatt Place on leisure again or if staying more than a day or two. I would gladly stay there again if alone on business for a limited time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Low Priced Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: texaswillie
Reviews.Content: This is our first stay at a Hyatt Place and were we surprised with one of the best stays at a low priced hotel we have had in a long time. The rooms are fantastic. Big screen (like 50 inch) flat screen LG TV. Lagre king size bed however we don't care for the soft mattress. Bathroom was one of the largest we have seen even in high dollar suites. There was a couch, computer table, frige and coffee maker. Breakfast was find however it was limited. One could order for a charge more food items. we opted for the continential as there was danish, bagles,Starbuck's Coffee,fresh fruit, etc. Self--free parking. Not a large lobby however who needs to pay for a large lobby. Two elevators with quick service for a six story hotel. Pool was closed due to weather.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in Memphis”
Reviews.Author: ar92ldm
Reviews.Content: We were driving across I40 on our way to nashville and picked this hotel to stay for 1 night. The location is excellent. Very close to multiple restaraunts and shopping centers. It's easy to access from the interstate. It's about 15 minutes to the east of downtown memphis so you get to avoid the AM traffic. The hotels decor was very trendy with 42 inch flatscreen tv's in all room. The staff was very nice and after check in the staff escorted us to our room. The hotel is in a very nice neighboorhood and even though it doesn't look like it was needed the hotel had a security guard in plain sight. The only two negative things I can say about our room is that the air conditioner was a bit loud and we had to remove a tiny spider that had taken up residents in our bed. I didn't report the air conditioner issue to the hotel staff but really feel that if I would have they would have moved me to a new room. Breakfast was very basic but they did have very good starbucks coffee. All-in-all, the Hyatt place is a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; nice service”
Reviews.Author: dwsact
Reviews.Content: This motel is well located near shopping in every price category. We ate at a fine restaurant just across Germantown Road. The room was clean. Free breakfast was fine. No complaints except we could have used a business center which they don't have.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice!”
Reviews.Author: jamfan
Reviews.Content: Needed to be in this area for business and stayed here. Looks brand new. What a nice hotel, I was so impressed, the service, the room, really great!!! Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and reasonable”
Reviews.Author: Girltrvlr
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because we were attending a family reunion in Memphis. The hotel is in a great area with lots of stores and a mall. There are many restaurants close by and it is close to the interstate. Our room was very nice and comfortable. The only negative was the check-in process was a little inefficient because they had just opened and there were some computer glitched. The hotel has a a self-serve type check in. There is a person at the desk if you have problems. I am certain this has been resolved since then.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Choice Of Hotels”
Reviews.Author: sodacrazy
Reviews.Content: The Staff was very polite and nice. We had a great stay in the hotel. The pool was clean. The fitness room was very nice and the hotel room was very clean. The breakfast was nice and they had some very healty choices.

Reviews.Title: “Much More than Expected”
Reviews.Author: ptm725
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in numerous hotels where I have walked into the lobby and have been blown away, then gotten to my room and my incredibly disappointed. This was NOT one of those hotels. The lobby was incredibly modern and the continental breakfast was great too (with free Starbucks). They had a few computers available for use and free WIFI in the rooms. The room had a huge sofa and flat screen TV. The bathroom was a bit small, but that is my ONLY complaint. This hotel truly impressed me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for a get away”
Reviews.Author: DrDMC
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms at the Hyatt Place as a central location for meeting family from out-of-state. The size and layout of the rooms served our purposes very well, and we were pleased with our stay. Grounds and Location The entire Hyatt Place property was very clean and well maintained. The parking area did not have any refuse in it and the borders of the property were mowed and clean. The location of the HP is sort of odd, being at the back of a large shopping complex. If you did not know a hotel was back there, it is not the first place you would think to look. The area is spacious, however, and you are within walking distance or a very short drive from a wide variety of stores. Parking for the hotel itself is rather limited, and on our first night, we had to park in an adjacent parking lot. Staff and Check-in Every single staff person we encountered was very friendly and helpful. We checked in late on a Friday evening right around shift change. Even though this is typically a difficult time for staff, you would not have known it from the service we received. Check-in is somewhat hampered by the size of the lobby / social area. Check-in is supposed to be accomplished by computer, but the system did not recognize our reservations. The staff desk area is rather small and is adjacent to a food service counter, so finding space was rather difficult. The entire lobby area is rather small, considering the purpose it is intended to serve, and 5 or 6 people can make easy passage to the front door rather difficult. Still, this is a minor issue. Room The rooms we had were very nice. Rooms are not opulent by any means, but they are very nicely decorated, clean and very comfortable. The sofabed, while not near being a pillow-top, was much more comfortable than such sofas typically are. The king size bed was a pillow-top and very comfortable. The room itself was spacious with ample space and furniture to accommodate 6 or 7 people without feeling cramped. The room has several little nooks and spaces for storing things, and the bath was very large. Everything in our rooms was very clean, including the shower and tub area. Of special note was the 42" LCD High-Def television. Not only was the television outstanding, but the control panel that allows you to hook up virtually any electronic device (laptop, DVD player, iPod, etc.) was very unique and quite well designed. Overall, the entire family was very pleased. While the Hyatt Place is not a full service hotel, such a Marriott or Hyatt Grand Regency, it serves the purpose for which it was intended very well.

HotelInfo.Name: Hyatt Place Wolfchase Galleria
HotelInfo.Address: 7905 Giacosa Place, Memphis, TN 38133
